intro: Sobralia danjanzenii, commonly known as the Danjanzen's sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features bright yellow and orange flowers that are typically borne on long, branched stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Sobralia danjanzenii is considered a threatened species in its natural range.
